get.description: Get ohms by supplying any 2 of the parameters
Get amps by supplying any 2 of the parameters
Get volts by supplying any 2 of the parameters
Get watts by supplying any 2 of the parameters
Determine the new gear ratio needed when moving to a different  tire size to keep the overall ratio the same.Also provides the effective gear  ratio with the current gearing and new tire size

parameters.name: newTireDiamIn
parameters.description: Diameter in inches of new tire

parameters.name: oldTireDiamIn
parameters.description: Diameter in inches of old tire

parameters.name: axleRatio
parameters.description: Ring & pinion ratio before the colon, ex. 3.73

get.description: Determine the engine RPM at a given speed for the combination of the  axle ratio, transmission gear and tire diameter

parameters.name: axleRatio
parameters.description: Ring & pinion ratio before the colon, ex. 3.73

parameters.name: vehicleSpeedMph
parameters.description: Vehicle speed in MPH

parameters.name: transRatio
parameters.description: Transmission ratio before the colon, ex. 2.54

parameters.name: tireDiamIn
parameters.description: Diameter in inches of tire

get.description: Determine the vehicle speed at a given engine RPM for the  combination of the tire diameter, transmission gear,  overdrive (if equipped, else 1, can also be used to figure a second transfer case),  transfer case (high or low gear as needed), and axle ratio

parameters.name: engineRpm
parameters.description: RPM of the engine

parameters.name: tireDiamIn
parameters.description: Diameter in inches of tire

parameters.name: transRatio
parameters.description: Transmission ratio before the colon, ex. 2.54

parameters.name: auxRatio
parameters.description: auxRatio Overdrive or second transfer case ratio before the colon,  ex. 4.0. or 1 if not equipped

parameters.name: tCaseRatio
parameters.description: Transfer case ratio before the colon, ex. 2.72

parameters.name: axleRatio
parameters.description: Ring & pinion ratio before the colon, ex. 3.73

get.description: Determine the crawl ratio for the provided parameters

parameters.name: axleRatio
parameters.description: Ring & pinion ratio before the colon, ex. 3.73

parameters.name: lowTCaseRatio
parameters.description: Transfer case ratio before the colon, ex. 2.72

parameters.name: transLowGearRatio
parameters.description: Transmission ratio before the colon, ex. 2.54

parameters.name: auxRatio
parameters.description: auxRatio Overdrive or second transfer case ratio before the colon,  ex. 4.0. or 1 if not equipped

get.description: Determine the rotation velocity which is how fast  an object rotates or revolves relative to another point

parameters.name: axleRatio
parameters.description: Ring & pinion ratio before the colon, ex. 3.73

parameters.name: speedMph
parameters.description: Vehicle speed in MPH

parameters.name: tireDiamIn
parameters.description: Diameter in inches of tire

get.description: Determine the gear ratio by counting teeth on the ring and pinion

parameters.name: ringGearTeeth
parameters.description: Number of teeth on the ring gear

parameters.name: pinionGearTeeth
parameters.description: Number of teeth on the pinion gear

get.description: Determine actual speed when changing tire sizes and not regearing.  The speedometer is still calibrated at factory specs and this will show what  speed you are actually running

parameters.name: newTireDiamIn
parameters.description: Diameter in inches of new tire

parameters.name: oldTireDiamIn
parameters.description: Diameter in inches of old tire

parameters.name: speedoMph
parameters.description: Vehicle speed in MPH as read on the speedometer

get.description: Calculate fuel cost for the desired runtime

parameters.name: numberHoursToRun
parameters.description: Number of hours desired to run

parameters.name: fuelPricePerUnit
parameters.description: Price of fuel per unit whether gallon or liter, but the unit used here  is the same unit used in the burnRateUPH

parameters.name: burnRateUPH
parameters.description: Fuel burn rate in your preferred units per hour(gallons, liters, etc.)  as long as the units matches the fuelPricePerUnit

get.description: Calculate runtime for the fuel tank

parameters.name: burnRateUPH
parameters.description: Fuel burn rate in your preferred units per hour(gallons, liters, etc.)  as long as the units matches the fuelTankCapacity

parameters.name: fuelTankCapacity
parameters.description: Fuel tank capacity in a unit matching the burnRateUPH

description.example: An API to handle multiple conversions and calculations in one place
